comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Bain has dated the photo January 20, 1914, which was about two months before the birth of Sir Alec Guinness, the famous actor, on April 2nd of that year. Loel Guinness (1906-1988) biography -- the Wikipedia version: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loel_Guinness Tate Gallery's biography of Meraud Guinness Guevara (1904-1993): www.tate.org.uk/servlet/ArtistWorks?cgroupid=999999961&am...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: The New York Times of December 28, 1913, has the story of the children's party given the day before by Mrs. Benjamin S. Guinness, of London and New York, at her New York residence, 8 Washington Square. Loel and Meraud played the roles of King and Queen in a children's comedy written for the occasion by Walter Creighton, "The Nosed Princess." (Young Alice Astor played the title role of Princess Cayenne Pepper.) The occasion was the birthday of another Guinness daughter, Tanis. Several Astors were present, and "motor cars were arriving with the children of society." query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9407E2DF113FE6...
